gurmukhi: ibsn nvIn khXo bpu DirXo ] j`ig ibGn Asurn ko kirho ]5]
transliteration: Bisan Naveen Kahyo Bap(u) Dhariho|| Jagg(i) Bighan Asuran Ko Kariho||5||
translation: Vishnu said, “I shall manifest myself in a new body, and destroy the Yajna of the demons.”5.

gurmukhi: ibsn AiDk kIno iesnwnw ] dIny Aimq idjn kh dwnw ]
transliteration: Bisan Adhik Keeno Isnaanaa|| Deene Amit Dijan Kah Daanaa||
translation: Vishnu then took bath at various pilgrim-stations, and distributed unlimited alms to the Brahmins.

gurmukhi: mn mo kvlw isrjo gXwnw ] kwl purK ko DrXo DXwnw ]6]
transliteration: Man Mo Kavlaa Sirjo Gyaanaa|| Kaal Purakh Ko Ddaryo Dhyaanaa||6||
translation: Brahma, born out of the heart-lotus of Vishnu, propagated the divine knowledge, and Vishnu mediated on the Immanent Lord.6.

gurmukhi: kwl purK qb Bey dieAwlw ] dws dwn kh bcn irswlw ]
transliteration: Kaal Purakh Tab Bhae Diaalaa|| Daas Daan Kah Bachanndrisaalaa||
translation: The Immanent Lord, then became Merciful and addressed his servant Vishnu with sweet words,

gurmukhi: Dr ArhMq dyv ko rUpw ] nws kro Asurn ky BUpw ]7]
transliteration: Dhar Arhant Dev Ko Roopaa|| Naas Daro Asuran Ke Bhoopaa||7||
translation: “O Vishnu, manifest yourself in the forms of Arhant, and destroy the kings of the demons.”7.

gurmukhi: ibsn dyv AwgXw jb pweI ] kwl purK kI krI bfweI ]
transliteration: Bisan Dev Aagyaa Jab Paaee|| Kaal Purakh Kikaribadaaee||
translation: Vishnu, after receiving the orders of the Immanent Lord, eulogized him.

gurmukhi: BUA ArhMq dyv bn AwXo ] Awn Aaur hI pMQ clwXo ]8]
transliteration: Bhooa Arhant Dev Ban Aayo|| Aan Aur Hipanh Chalaayo||8||
translation: He manifested himself as Arhant Dev on the earth and started a new religion.8.

gurmukhi: jb Asurn ko BXo guru AweI ] bhuiq BwNiq inj mqih clweI ]
transliteration: Jab Asuran Ko Bhyo Gur(u) Aaee|| Bahout(i) Bhaant(i) Nij Matah(i) Chadhaaee||
translation: When he became the preceptor of the demons, he started different kinds of sects.

gurmukhi: sRwvg mq auprwjn kIAw ] sMq sbUhn ko suK dIAw ]9]
transliteration: Sraavat Mat Oupraajan Keeaa|| Sant Saboohan Ko Soukh Deeaa||9||
translation: One of the sects he started was Shravak sect (Jainism) and bestowed supreme comfort to the saints.9.

gurmukhi: sBhUM hwQ mocnw dIey ] isKw hIx dwnv bhu kIey ]
transliteration: Sabhdhoondhaath Mochnaa Deee|| Sikhaa Heen Daanav Bahu Keee||
translation: He caused all to hold the forceps for plucking hair and in this way he made many demons devoid of the lock of hair on the crown of the head.

gurmukhi: isKw hIx koeI sMqR n PurY ] jo koeI jpY ault iqh prY ]10]
transliteration: Sikhaa Heen Koimantra Na Phuraee|| Jo Koijapai Ulat Tih Darai||10||
translation: Those without hair or without the lock of hair on the crown of their heads could not remember any mantra and if anyone repeated the mantra, there was negative influence of the mantra on him.10.

gurmukhi: bhur j`g qo krb imtwXo ] jIA ihMsw qy sBhUM htwXo ]
transliteration: Bhaur Jagg To Karab Mitaayo|| Jeea Hinsaa Te Sabhdhoondhataayo||
translation: Then he ended the performance of Yajnas and made all indifferent to the idea of violence on beings.

gurmukhi: ibn ihMsw kIA j`g n hoeI ] qw qy j`g krY nw koeI ]11]
transliteration: Bin Hinsaa Keea Jagg Na Hoee|| Taa Te Jagg Darai Naa Koee||11||
translation: There can be no Yajna without the violence on beings, therefore no one performed Yajna now.11.

gurmukhi: Xw qy BXo jgn ko nwsw ] jo jIX hny hoie auphwsw ]
transliteration: Yaa Te Bhaho Jagad Ko Naasaa|| Jo Jeeya Hane Hoe Oup-haasaa||
translation: In this way, the practice of performing Yajnas was destroyed and anyone who used to kill beings, he was ridiculed.
